com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface

Interface ScalableSurface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PaintCanvas, PaintSurface, ScanlineSurface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPaintCanvas, AbstractPaintSurface, JMonetCanvas

    public interface ScalableSurface
    An surface that has an observable scale factor associated with it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point convertModelPointToView(Point p)
      Converts a point within the surface's image (model) to an equivalent point in the surface component's coordinate space, accounting for scale and scroll error as appropriate.
      Point convertViewPointToModel(Point p)
      Converts a point on the visible surface (view) to the equivalent point within the surface's image (model), taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.
      double getScale()
      Gets the displayed scale factor of this image.

      Gets an observable provider of the current scale factor.

      Scales a given dimension by the current scale factor.
      default Point scalePoint(Point p)
      Scales a point by the current scale factor.
      void setScale(double scale)
      Sets the scale factor of the canvas.

    • Method Detail

      • getScale

        double getScale()
        Gets the displayed scale factor of this image.
        Returns:
        The displayed scale factor of this image.

      • setScale

        void setScale(double scale)
        Sets the scale factor of the canvas. Values greater than 1 result in the canvas image appearing enlarged; values less than 1 result in the canvas image appearing shrunken. When enlarging the canvas (scale greater than 1), only whole values are allowed; the fractional portion of the argument will be rounded to the nearest whole integer.

        Changes to scale attempt to zoom-in or zoom-out on the area currently centered in the viewport (when the surface is embedded in a JScrollPane and managed with a SurfaceScrollController).

        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor

      • getScaleObservable

        io.reactivex.Observable<Double> getScaleObservable()
        Gets an observable provider of the current scale factor.
        Returns:
        An observable scale factor.

      • scaleDimension

        default Dimension scaleDimension(Dimension d)
        Scales a given dimension by the current scale factor.
        Parameters:
        d - The dimension to scale
        Returns:
        A new dimension whose height and width have been multiplied by the scale factor.

      • scalePoint

        default Point scalePoint(Point p)
        Scales a point by the current scale factor.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to scale
        Returns:
        A new point whose x and y coordinate has been multiplied by the scale factor.

      • convertViewPointToModel

        Point convertViewPointToModel(Point p)
        Converts a point on the visible surface (view) to the equivalent point within the surface's image (model), taking into account scale, grid and scroll pane complications as appropriate.

        When a scale factor has been applied, the input coordinates are divided by the scale factor. When a grid factor has been applied, the result is rounded to the nearest grid spacing factor. When the surface is being scrolled and a scale greater than or equal to 1.0 is applied, then the scroll error is factored in (see ScrollableSurface#getScrollError for details).

        See convertModelPointToView(Point) for the reverse function.

        Parameters:
        p - A point in scaled, surface space
        Returns:
        The equivalent point in terms of the canvas image.

      • convertModelPointToView

        Point convertModelPointToView(Point p)
        Converts a point within the surface's image (model) to an equivalent point in the surface component's coordinate space, accounting for scale and scroll error as appropriate.

        Note that there is no concept of snap-to-grid when converting from model to view (only when converting in the opposite direction).

        See convertViewPointToModel(Point) for the reverse function.

        Parameters:
        p - A point within the canvas' image bounds
        Returns:
        The equivalent point in the coordinate space of the surface component
